original_table_html:
Brand Original Product Extension Products New Brand Meaning
Weight Watchers Fitness centers Low-calorie foods Weight loss and maintenance
Sunkist Oranges Vitamins, juices Good health
Kelloggâ€™s Cereal Nutri-Grain bars, Special K bars Healthy snacking
Aunt Jemima Pancake mixes Syrups, frozen waffles Breakfast foods
summary_markdown: This table illustrates brand extension strategies, detailing how established brands leverage their equity to introduce new products. It presents four examples: Weight Watchers, originally known for fitness centers, extended into low-calorie foods to reinforce its brand meaning of weight loss and maintenance. Sunkist, a brand associated with oranges, expanded into vitamins and juices, broadening its meaning to encompass good health. Kellogg's, a cereal manufacturer, introduced Nutri-Grain and Special K bars, shifting its brand meaning towards healthy snacking. Finally, Aunt Jemima, known for pancake mixes, diversified into syrups and frozen waffles, solidifying its brand meaning around breakfast foods. The structure is comparative, showcasing different brands and their respective original products, extension products, and the resulting new brand meanings.
